instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not charge - no liquid
threads.message:
have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has no liquid damage whats so ever, no damage checked with microscope, cleanest board ive seen, computer works perfectly normal turns on and keeps running, tested with other entire computer all known to work, confirmed board issue.

but none of the usbC ports read any cord, should i replace both <CHIP>U3100</CHIP> AND U 3200

or any experience of what else it could be?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - does not charge - no liquid
threads.message:
"none of the usbC ports read any cord"
I do not exactly understand you...

USB-C meter stays in 5V?
Or machine doesn't detect USB devices?
